nodes.bodyText:
Extract to constant to be consistent with other code:
    private static final Logger LOGGER = LoggerFactory.getLogger(SearchBasedParserFetcher.java .class);
I'll add a comment that variables are not possible in interfaces (are they?)
Sorry, did not see it's an interface. Variables are possibe in interface, but only public. You could extract it to a default method but I think in this case it's irrelevant
Since you rethrow the exception anyway, I don't think you need to add a logger statement here. It's the job of the caller to decide how to handle (i.e. log / show to user) the exception.
I switch to debug. Better more logging than too less.

OK, found some article in the net that one should either log or throw the excpetion --> https://howtodoinjava.com/best-practices/java-exception-handling-best-practices/#6
Therefore, introdcuging String.format for the exception message.
Is it really necessary to extract this from the try (...) statement? I found the previous version easier to understand.

Aim: I want to log when the URL is incorrect

I don't know how to include it in the same try:
Sorry, I cannot follow. The previous code had a URISyntaxException handler...

Well, the code duplication was introduced in the complex-query-PR. We've accepted it as a temporary solution, which should be replaced by forwarding the normal search by query method to the search by complex query method or what is probably better in the long term is to completely replace all normal text-based search fetcher by complex query fetchers. I'm not sure if your changes here really help for this.

Note that the discussion on the code duplication is separate from the discussion how to log URLs. Sorry for doing two things in one PR - and discussing two things without making it excplicit that we are discussing two things.
In the context of URL creation and logging, I created the ADR-0014 summarizing our discussion. The full file is there: https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/blob/fix-fetchers/docs/adr/0014-separate-URL-creation-to-enable-proper-logging.md
Here are the options:

Separate URL creation (my favorite)
Create URL when logging the URL (IMHO your favorite)
Include URL creation as statement before the stream creation in the try-with-resources block

I agree if you really need the url in the catch block, then the code that you had before (creating it before the try with resource block) is the best. I'm still not convinced that you should show the URL to the user. It's only somewhat helpful for a developer fixing the fetcher tests, but not for a user (except if I overlook something).
But that's actually a topic for a bigger discussion: where and how to log vs throw exceptions. I propose we move this discussion to the JabCon. Since if i understood you correctly, the aim of this PR is to fix some of the fetcher, I would suggest to extract all other changes (log & refactoring) to their own PR. Then we can merge this on, so that we finally release 5.1. What do you think?

Ah, I get the point for "showing the URL". Call for an ADR ^^. https://howtodoinjava.com/best-practices/java-exception-handling-best-practices/#6
I take the freedom to choose "Separate URL creation" (and do not refactor the interface).

Well, the merged version still contains the refactored interface, as well as the disabled tests. It would be nice if you could revist those points in one of the next evenings, when everything is a bit more quite and no coming release is hanging over our heads creating the impression of urgency.
We included a private method in the interface, which reduced code clones. I will create a new issue for tracking.
Added as issue --> koppor#467
Isn't a regex better / more flexible than this manual string splitting?

The initial shot is
Pattern pattern = Pattern.compile("\(([a-z]+:)?\([a-z]+\):\([^; ]+)\(; )?\)*");
Maybe, some () are still wrong. I find that harder than going "manually" throught he AST
I can use JavaCC (or ANTLR) to generate a grammar and parse the AST of CCSB identifier field. This is the recommended computer science way. Maye at a follow-up pull-request.
I like the regex ;-)
only set the field when it's empty?
Similar to above, why did you moved the try block?
Given the problems with the google fetcher, is it really wise to query it a second time for the next 10 results?
Removed additional call.
Can also be removed in my opinion.
Comments can be deleted in my opinion
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -66,7 +67,12 @@ public void performSearchReturnsMatchingMultipleEntries() throws FetcherExceptio
 
         BibEntry secondBibEntry = new BibEntry(StandardEntryType.Article)
                 .withCiteKey("oai:DiVA.org:lnu-68408")
-                .withField(new UnknownField("identifier"), "urn:isbn:978-1-4503-5217-8; doi:10.1145/3129790.3129810; ISI:000426556400034; Scopus 2-s2.0-85037741580")
+                // instead of the plain "identifier" field, the converter maps that field to

nodes.bodyText: I'm a bit split between adding disabled here or not. The fetcher doesn't adhere to the interface tested here, so it's correct that the test is failing, or not? I'm a bit afraid that once you mark tests as disabled, no one will try to fix it because well there are no failing tests, right?
Added to the agenda of JabCon

Do you really think we need to show the url to the user? What is the additional value of this? They cannot click on it anyway, and mostly likely the error is not in the url but in their configuration or because their internet is down.
